Description: Neck fragment of North Ionian Late Wild Goat pottery krater; glaze fired red-brown; interior glazed; exterior, cream slip: part of a wild goat to right with added red patches on shoulders and neck; horizontal band below; filling ornaments: rosettes and swastikas with rounded angles.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.475)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
